com.googlecode.javastar
Class AstarCalculator<N extends Node,C extends Cost<C>>

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.javastar.AstarCalculator<N,C>

public class AstarCalculator<N extends Node,C extends Cost<C>>
extends java.lang.Object

The actual A star calculation happens within this class.
This class heavily relies on the AstarHelper subclass that is provided upon construction.

Author:
Steven Roose

Constructor Summary
AstarCalculator(AstarHelper<N,C> astarHelper)
          Create a new A star calculator object with your own AstarHelper subclass.

Constructor Detail

AstarCalculator

public AstarCalculator(AstarHelper<N,C> astarHelper)
Create a new A star calculator object with your own AstarHelper subclass.

Method Detail

setMaximumNumberOfNodesToExpand

public void setMaximumNumberOfNodesToExpand(long maximumNumberOfNodesToExpand)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Specify how many nodes should be expanded at most. The algorithm will stop if this number of nodes have been expanded.

Parameters:
maximumNumberOfNodesToExpand - the maximum number of nodes to expand
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maximumNumberOfNodesToExpand is lower than 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the calculation is already running

getResult

public AstarResult<N,C> getResult()
Retrieve the result of the last A star calculation. When no calculation has been performed, null is returned.
The following holds:
- result.getType() == SUCCESS if the calculation was successful
- result.getType() == FAIL if the calculation failed

Returns:
the result of the last A star calculation
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the calculation is not yet finished.

run

public void run()
Run the calculation.

When the calculation is finished, the result will be in getResult().
